Variables

param_t params []
 An arry to store all paraeters.

Detailed Description

This naspace contains utils functions of the vishnu system.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum vishnu::CmdStatus

The status of the command execution.

Enumerator:
CMDFAILED 

command failed

CMDSUCCESS 

command success

enum vishnu::CmdType

The type of the command.

Enumerator:
UMS 

For UMS command type

TMS 

For TMS command type

FMS 

For FMS command type

IMS 

For IMS command type

enum vishnu::IdType

The type of id generated.

Enumerator:
MACHINE 

For the machines

USER 

For The users

JOB 

For the jobs

FILETRANSFERT 

For the file tranfers

AUTH 

For the authentication system

Function Documentation

int vishnu::addAuthAccount ( const std::string &  sessionKey,
const UMS_Data::AuthAccount &  authAccount 
) throw (UserException, SystemException)

Function to add a new local user-authentication configuration.

Parameters:
sessionKey is the encrypted identifier of the session generated by VISHNU
authAccount is an object which encapsulates the information of the local user-authentication configuration which will be added in VISHNU
Returns:
an error code

) throw (UserException, SystemException)

Function to add a new user-authentication system in VISHNU.

Parameters:
sessionKey is the encrypted identifier of the session generated by VISHNU
newAuthSys is an object which encapsulates the information of the user-authentication system which will be added in VISHNU
Returns:
an error code
int vishnu::addLocalAccount ( const std::string &  sessionKey,
const UMS_Data::LocalAccount &  newLocalAccount,
std::string &  sshPublicKey 
) throw (UserException, SystemException)

Function to add a new local user configuration.

Parameters:
sessionKey is the encrypted identifier of the session generated by VISHNU
newLocalAccount is is the object which encapsulates the new local user configuration
sshPublicKey the SSH public key generated by VISHNU for accessing a local account
Returns:
raises an exception on error

UMS_Data::Machine &  newMachine 
) throw (UserException, SystemException)

Function to add a new machine in VISHNU.

Parameters:
sessionKey is the encrypted identifier of the session generated by VISHNU
newMachine is an object which encapsulates the information of the machine which will be added in VISHNU except the machine id which will be created automatically by VISHNU
Returns:
raises an exception on error

) throw (UserException, SystemException)

Function to open a session.

Parameters:

int vishnu::listAuthAccounts ( const std::string &  sessionKey,
UMS_Data::ListAuthAccounts &  listAuthAccounts,
const UMS_Data::ListAuthAccOptions &  options = UMS_Data::ListAuthAccOptions() 
) throw (UserException, SystemException)

Function to lists local user-authentication configurations.

Parameters:
sessionKey is the encrypted identifier of the session generated by VISHNU
listAuthAccounts is the list of the local user-authentication configurations
options allows an admin to list all local user-authentication configurations or to list local user-authentication configurations of a specific user or for a user to list local user-authentication configuration defined for a specific user-authentication system
Returns:
an error code
int vishnu::listAuthSystems ( const std::string &  sessionKey,
UMS_Data::ListAuthSystems &  listAuthSys,
const UMS_Data::ListAuthSysOptions &  options = UMS_Data::ListAuthSysOptions() 
) throw (UserException, SystemException)

Function to lists VISHNU user-authentification systems.

Parameters:
sessionKey is the encrypted identifier of the session generated by VISHNU
listAuthSys is the list of the user-authentication systems
options allows an admin to list all user-authentication systems used by a specific user or a user to list all user-authentication systems declared in VISHNU (and not only those where a local user-authentication configs are defined). It also allows to list user-authentication systems of a specific type
Returns:
an error code

string  machineId,
IMS_Data::LoadShedType  loadShedType 
) throw (UMSVishnuException, IMSVishnuException, UserException, SystemException)

To load shed a machine.

Parameters:
sessionKey,: The session key gotten after connection
machineId,: The id of the machine to load shed
loadShedType,: The type of load shedding, HARD or SOFT. HARD stops all whereas SOFT stops jobs but they can be restarted later
Returns:
int : an error code

dest,: the "destination" file path using host:path format

options contains the options used to perform the service (like the transfer command :scp or rsync)

int vishnu::submitJob ( const std::string &  sessionKey,
const std::string &  machineId,
const std::string &  scriptFilePath,
Job &  jobInfo,
const SubmitOptions &  options = SubmitOptions() 
) throw (UMSVishnuException, TMSVishnuException, UserException, SystemException)

The submitJob function submits job on a machine through the use of a script (scriptFilePath).

Parameters:
sessionKey : The session key
machineId : Is the id of the machine on which the job must be submitted
scriptFilePath : The path to the file containing the characteristics (job command, and batch scheduler directive required or optional) of the job to submit.
jobInfo : The Job object containing the output information (ex: jobId and jobPath) of the job to submit
options : Is an instance of the class SubmitOptions. Each optionnal value is associated to a set operation (e.g: setNbCpu(...)) in the class SubmitOptions. If no set operation is not called on the instance object options, the job is submitted with the options defined in the scriptFilePath. Otherewise the job is submitted with the optionnal values set by the options object and optionnal values defined in the scriptFilePath, but optionnal values set by SubmitOptions object take precedence over those in scriptFilePath. With in the object options or within the scriptFilePath, the last occurance of an optionnal value takes precedence over earlier occurance.
Returns:
int : an error code
int vishnu::tailOfFile ( const string &  sessionKey,
const string &  path,
string &  contentOfFile,
const TailOfFileOptions &  options = TailOfFileOptions() 
) throw (UMSVishnuException, FMSVishnuException, UserException, SystemException)

get the last lines of a file

path the file path using host:path format
contentOfFile the last "nline" lines of the file
options the options used to perform the service
contentOfFile an user-allocated buffer to store the result
Returns:
0 if everything is OK, another value otherwise
